Aside from that, analyzing their marketing tactics can reveal their shortcomings, giving you the chance to create more effective and appealing campaigns. Competitive benchmarking is essential for setting internal performance standards and aligning the key performance indicators (KPIs) with industry norms. For example, if the industry average for customer satisfaction is 90%, your goal is to meet or, better yet, exceed that target. The higher, the better. And lastly, regularly reviewing these benchmarks can help you a lot in keeping your product competitive and meeting industry expectations. 4. Negative feedback on specific features from a competitor offers you a chance to avoid similar errors and focus on improving areas where your product can excel. When done properly, this could result in higher-quality offerings. Gaining broader industry observations can also provide you with valuable insights. Try checking out public forums and review sites.
